intro: Dictyosperma album, commonly known as the white bracken. It is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in panicles, which are typically borne on the upper parts of the stems. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The species is part of the family Araceae, which includes many plants with similar morphological features.
